misdeed: A once-thriving mining town is now on the brink of collapse. Tunnels cave in with alarming frequency, tremors shake the earth, and miners whisper of a terrifying presence lurking in the depths.
solution: The Vaesen is a Giant and can be banished by ringing church bells, raising a cross near its dwelling, or discovering and speaking its true name.

clues.description: The tremors seem to originate from the deepest part of the mine, an area where the veins of ore run particularly rich.
Miners report hearing earth-shaking roars echoing through the tunnels, followed by an unnatural silence.
Strange symbols, too large and ancient to have been carved by human hands, are found on the walls of a newly unearthed cavern.
An enormous footprint, pressed deep into the muddy ground, is discovered near the entrance to the collapsed mine shaft.
Local legends speak of a slumbering giant who dwells beneath the mountains, angered by the intrusion of the miners.
A piece of ancient pottery, depicting a giant being chained beneath the earth, is unearthed in a nearby archaeological dig.

plotTwist.description: The mine's foreman, desperate to increase production and save his job, has unknowingly disturbed the Vaesen's slumber with his reckless excavation.
